be for president or governor, gave few clues Monday as he addressed the Indiana General Assembly. Those who expect Mike Pence , R-Columbus, to run for governor may have been heartened by his statement to lawmakers that the states hold the promise of the future. Those who are pushing him instead to run for the Eugene White House in 2012 may focus in on his call for a "new federalism" -- which sounded like a budding presidential slogan.

Former Republican state Mike Pence Jackie Walorski , a tea party favorite who narrowly lost her race last year against Democratic Mike Pence Joe Donnelly in northern Indiana, said she was excited by the prospect of Mike Pence running for governor. I think he's the clear front-runner, and I think the race is his if he chooses to accept it, Jackie Walorski said. "I think he'd clear the field." Gov.
